result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant JaMarcus I McKeown appeared by video.  Attorney John j Forrestal in court for JaMarcus I McKeown.  Prosecuting attorney Kylan Reilly in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge VanGrunsven Branch 09.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 09.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 099908,
Payable Number: 1040106,
Receipt Number: 22RP042210,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant JaMarcus I McKeown in court.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for JaMarcus I McKeown.  Prosecuting Attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Mr. McKeown would like time to retain private. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant JaMarcus I McKeown in court.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for JaMarcus I McKeown.  Prosecuting attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. for Patrick Franken in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Status conference regarding Status of Counsel appointment.  Attorney OReilly has recently been appointed by the Public Defender's Office.  Case adjourned for Preliminary hearing before Br. PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant JaMarcus I McKeown in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  JaMarcus I McKeown appeared by video means.  
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. SPD failed to appoint counsel. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Status Of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for JaMarcus I McKeown
Current: 932 W Chambers Ave LOWER, Milwaukee, WI 53206 United States  (Effective: 08-10-2022)
Prior: 2424 North 33rd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.

Defendant JaMarcus I McKeown in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Gregg Herman along with student intern Josh Rather under the student practice rule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Van Grunsven, Branch 09.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/10/2022@1pm
